Programs
The programs to be offered by the network are submitted
to a Program Acceptance Committee for approval. The committee
is presently: George Probst, Jim Miles,and Robert Hudson. The
committee has held one meeting. A second meeting has not been
reouested in view of impending action by the foundations and
the current meeting of the board of directors of the NAEB. In
lieu of a committee meeting copies of programs have been mailed
to committee members for auditioning.
. Such comment about programs as seems appropriate at this
time is reserved for a later portion of tnis report*
Tape Numbers and Tape Card File
All reels of tape have been given an NAEB number. The
numbers are typed on a small piece of cardboard and then scotch-
taped to a spoke of the reel. A card index is maintained by reel
number, showing the location of the reel and what is on it. This
provides a reasonably accurate running inventory of the tape
supply.
Cue Sheets
V;e have undertaken to send out cue sheets with all programs*
The cue sheets show, series number and name, program number and
title, the order of playing by NAEB reel number, opening and
closing cues for each reel, and the times. We attempt to get
accurate timings, but at present we have nothing better than
Megnecordhs- or. -tfhdrch â€œto "time* These machines do not time with
absolute accuracy. Hov;ever, except for possible errors, the
times should be within workable limits*
